title: ICE on `let _: uint = true as _;`: "asked to compute contents of error type"

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Tested with `rustc 0.13.0-dev (de83d7dd1 2014-12-06 20:12:13 +0000)`, but according to @eddyb, the ICE still happens on newer versions of rustc.

The error message is the same as in #19206.

```
ice.rs:2:19: 2:28 error: the type of this value must be known in this context
ice.rs:2     let _: uint = true as _;
                           ^~~~~~~~~
error: internal compiler error: asked to compute contents of error type
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
task 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', /home/jonathan/dev/rust/rust/src/libsyntax/diagnostic.rs:180

stack backtrace:
   1:     0x7f1c4bc4be10 - rt::backtrace::imp::write::ha2392ceb86293671Cly
```
